page.title: 12BOUGHTON PUBS
page.content: Boughton Monchelsea has two pubs, the 'Albion' and the 'Cock Inn'. The 'Albion', situated in the middle of the village, was built about 1800 on the site of an older coaching-house, its first recorded owner being a farmer in 1812. For many years it was used as a posting-house. The present landlords, not long in residence, are keen to keep the local trade, but are also busy trying to build up the food side of the business. The pub is plain but traditional in style and popular with the locals. The 'Cock Inn', an attractive weatherboarded building dating from about 1400, stands on the long straight Heath Road between Coxheath and Langley. It is used mainly by passers-by, and so is not really in competition with the nearby 'Albion'.
